spec.title: The OpenGL ES® Shading Language, Version 3.20.8

steps.html: If a feature is marked as optional.
Where a maximum value is stated (e.g. the maximum number of vertex outputs), the implementation may support a higher value than that specified.
No means the qualifiers do not need to match.
Consistent means qualifiers may be missing from a subset of declarations but they cannot conflict
If there are conflicting qualifiers, only the last of these is significant.
Matching is based only on the resulting qualification, not on the presence or otherwise of qualifiers.

The rules apply to all declared variables, irrespective of whether they are statically used, with the exception of inputs and outputs when shaders are linked (see “Input Output Matching by Name in Linked Programs”).
